page.title: 18THE LIFE OF A MINER
page.content: It is a hard and dangerous job working underground at Creswell Colliery. People can still remember Tuesday September 26th 1950 when forty miners went to work down the pit and never returned. There is a memorial stone in the church yard to the miners who died in that terrible disaster. Jonathan's dad is a deputy at the colliery and it is his job to check the safety of the mine and to help organise the work underground. An important part of his job is to check for gas down the mine and make sure the levels do not get too high. The colliery has to work 24 hours a day, so the miners have to work a shift system. At Creswell Colliery the day shift is from 6.00 a.m. to 1.30 p.m., the afternoon shift from 12.30 p.m. to 7.45 p.m. and the night shift from 10.00 p.m. to 5.15 a.m.
